messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] book/game ideas???  for younger crowd
messages.msgSnippet: Julie, For our recent car trip with our 3 y/o, my Mother sent a bag of surprises to be opened at regular intervals.  Some snacks, some little toys (like
messages.messageBody:
Julie,

For our recent car trip with our 3 y/o, my Mother sent a bag of surprises to
be opened at regular intervals. Some snacks, some little toys (like
matchbox cars, stickers, small book), she wrapped or bagged each surprise
separately so it took a little time to open. We also took music that we all
enjoyed - Ella Jenkins folk songs, some Coltrane, Beatles, etc. and I
packed music makers- rhythm sticks, & assorted such items. Plus we stopped
once for a rare treat - fast food french fries & shake. We didn't even need
all the snacks & 'prises' my Mother sent, it went really well and believe me
I was worried!

Have Fun,
Cindy L.



----- Original Message -----
From: <Jaam1224@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 1:46 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] book/game ideas???



>
> These are great ideas....any ideas for really little ones like 3 and
1....I
> am taking a 5hr trip in a couple of week and not looking forward to the
> drive....
>
> Julie
>
